lessons.japanese: 潮の満ち干は月の運行に左右される。
lessons.indonesian: The rise and fall of the sea is governed by the moon.

lessons.japanese: 我々の船は潮によって岸へ押し流された。
lessons.indonesian: Our boat drifted to shore on the tide.

lessons.japanese: どんなものにも潮時がある。
lessons.indonesian: There is a time for everything.

lessons.japanese: だれしも世の風潮には抵抗しがたいものだ。
lessons.indonesian: Everyone of us will have to accept the current of the times.

lessons.japanese: その子の顔がサンタクロースを見て高潮した。
lessons.indonesian: The child's face glowed when he saw Santa Claus.

lessons.japanese: きょうの満潮は午後３時です。
lessons.indonesian: High tide is at 3 p.m. today.

lessons.japanese: 風と潮の流れがその舟を岸に押しやった。
lessons.indonesian: The wind and tide impelled the ship to the shore.

lessons.japanese: 筆者はそうした風潮を好まない。
lessons.indonesian: The present writer doesn't like such a tendency.

lessons.japanese: 彼女は期待で興奮して顔を紅潮させた。
lessons.indonesian: Expectation caused her to be flushed with excitement.

lessons.japanese: 彼は潮時を見て発言した。
lessons.indonesian: He seized an opportunity to speak.

lessons.japanese: 彼は潮の流れに逆らって泳ごうとした。
lessons.indonesian: He tried to swim against the tide.

lessons.japanese: 彼は世の風潮に逆らう。
lessons.indonesian: He is swimming against the tide.
